page.title: 01CHEBSEY AND SHALLOWFORD
page.content: The area is one of rolling countryside which reaches a height of 133 metres towards the south-west. The patchwork of fields is based around the valleys of the River Sow and Meece Brook. The area is dotted with several old marl pits and small copses. There are two concentrations of population, the hamlets of Shallowford and Chebsey. Otherwise it is mainly a farming community plus a few large private dwellings. The east side of our area is bordered by the main line railway between London and Crewe or Stoke-on-Trent. Norton Bridge station is just within our north boundary. An unclassified road runs alongside the railway. Crossing the area from east to west is the A5013 between Stafford (4 miles away) and Eccleshall (2 miles away).
